feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 15 at 5:17AM AKDT until September 17 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta Coast, including Kuskokwim Bay. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise 4 to 7 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...From Friday afternoon through Saturday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 2:35AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality Impacts... * Smoke from the Mosquito wildfire continues to produce unhealthy to hazardous air quality across the region. The latest air quality observations indicate the worst conditions to be concentrated near Truckee and extending into Reno, Sparks, and the North Valleys.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 8:20AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TROPICAL FUNNEL CLOUDS POSSIBLE TODAY... entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous surf conditions and rip currents expected due to breaking waves around 6 feet, subsiding around 5 feet tonight. * WHERE...Beaches of St Croix.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 14 at 11:51AM PDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 8:23AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Weather Advisory for Patchy Dense Fog across south central Wisconsin Until 10 AM... Patchy Dense Fog has developed across portions of south central Wisconsin, with visibilities dropping to 1/2 mile or less in isolated areas. Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 15 at 4:59AM CDT until September 15 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches. * WHEN...Through this evening.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 15 at 4:46AM CDT until September 15 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Fox River Lower At Waukesha affecting Waukesha County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM CDT. &&

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 15 at 4:07AM CDT until September 16 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Strong currents due to wave action expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door and Kewaunee Counties. * WHEN...From 3 PM CDT this afternoon through late tonight.
